translation: We want to become tathāgatas, worshipful offerings, and perfectly enlightened in the pure Buddha land, which is called the pure place where the bodhisattva Samantabhadra practices bodhisattva actions, and thus we practice the six perfections to accomplish the perfect awakening in the Buddha land.'

translation: *Tathāgata Ratnaketu also thus granted ten thousand indolent people the prediction, 'When Samantabhadra Bodhisattva achieves unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, you too will achieve unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment in all the worlds around you.'

translation: Each of you will attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment in a different country on the same day, and you'll live for 10 small eons.

source_sentence: 汝等亦當同日入無上涅槃，後佛土正法七日皆滅。』
translation: You will also enter unsurpassed nirvāṇa on the same day, and the true teaching of the subsequent Buddha-lands will cease in seven days.'

source_sentence: 「彼十千人五體稽首禮寶藏如來足。
translation: "Those 10,000 people bowed their heads with five bodies at the feet of the Ratnagarbha Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 寶藏如來言：「『起汝等妙堅龍吼，　　當求習最積善財；　　勤修六度莫懈怠，　　當為天人作導師。』
translation: The Ratnagarbha Tathāgata said, 'Arise, you wonderfully resolute dragons, seek to cultivate the greatest accumulation of good fortune, diligently cultivate the six perfections without laziness, and you will be teachers to gods and humans.'

source_sentence: 第十一
translation: eleventh

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時海濟婆羅門語第九王子阿彌具，略說。
translation: It was then that the Haiji Brāhmaṇa spoke to Amitâbha, the ninth prince, and outlined what he had said.

source_sentence: 彼白佛言：『我當如是行菩薩行，令十方恒河沙數世界中，恒河沙數現在住世諸佛世尊，證我行菩薩菩提行。
translation: He said to the Buddha, 'I will thus carry out the bodhisattva's practice, so that in the numberless worlds of the Ganges River in the ten directions, the numberless buddhas and world-honored ones who are now living in the world will realize that I'm carrying out the bodhisattva's enlightening practice.'

source_sentence: 唯！
translation: Yes!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如我今於佛前發菩提心，乃至成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，於其中間行菩提行莫令心悔，乃至菩提際誓願堅固，如說修行不惱他心；令我不生聲聞、辟支佛心；令我心意不生愛欲，不與眠睡、慠慢、輕弄、誑惱、疑惑共俱；不與殺生、偷盜及非梵行，妄語、兩舌、麤言、綺語、無明、掉動、邪見、嫉妬等俱；無不敬法心，亦無離心。
translation: Now, as I have aroused the mind of enlightenment before the Buddha and have attained the unsurpassed, corrected, and uncontaminated enlightenment, I mustn't cause my mind to repent and vow to remain resolute until the limit of enlightenment, cultivating my practice as instructed so as not to disturb others' minds; so that I won't give rise to the minds of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas; so that my mind won't give rise to craving, not with drowsiness, arrogance, fussiness, harshness, doubt, and confusion; not with killing, stealing, unchaste behavior, false speech, duplicity, coarse speech, harsh speech, ignorance, agitation, wrong views, jealousy, and so forth; and not with a mind that doesn't respect the Dharma or a mind that's free of it.

source_sentence: 我行菩薩行時，乃至菩提際，莫令心有如是等法。
translation: When I'm practicing the bodhisattva path, I mustn't allow my mind to have such things up to the point of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 願我乃至菩提際，舉足下足心常念佛，乃至菩提際，未曾不見佛、不聞法、不供養僧。
translation: May I always be mindful of the Buddha with my feet up and down until the time of enlightenment, and I've never failed to see the Buddha, hear the Dharma, or make offerings to the saṃgha until the time of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 在所生處常得出家，常糞掃衣但三衣，樹下止常坐空閑處，常乞食少欲知足，常說法言無染著語；令我具足無量辯才，常不犯根罪，不雜妄語非毀他論，常念於空為女說法，常思惟空。
translation: Where I'm born, I'll always leave home, always wear robes made of rags but three robes, always sit in a lonely place under a tree, always beg for food with few desires and be satisfied, always speak the Dharma without defiled speech, perfect my measureless eloquence, always refrain from committing root crimes, refrain from speaking falsely and not disparaging other's views, always be mindful of emptiness as I teach women, and always contemplate emptiness.

source_sentence: 於女人前不露齒笑，不染相動手為人說法。
translation: I don't smile with my teeth when I'm in the presence of a woman, and I don't stain my features and move my hand to preach for others.

source_sentence: 我常於大乘菩薩，有師事供養之心。
translation: I always have the intention of serving and supporting the great vehicle bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 我若從他聞法敬意如師，我常恭敬沙門婆羅門，尊重供養唯如來前。
translation: If I hear the Dharma from others and venerate them as my teachers, I always respect ascetics and priests, and I venerate and make offerings only to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 我不觀應與不應與而為布施，我於法施不生嫉妬心，我以身命濟應死者，自以精進辦及眾物救厄眾生。
translation: I don't observe what should and shouldn't be given and then give alms, I don't become jealous of Dharma giving, I give my life to help those who deserve it, and I save sentient beings with my own effort and with the provision of various goods.

source_sentence: 我不說在家、出家是非長短；我常觀察利、養、稱、譽，如火如毒如怨，心常遠避。
translation: I don't speak of the relative merits of laymen and renunciant monks, but I always observe that profit, nurturing, praise, and honor are like fire, poison, and enmity, and I always steer clear of them.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若我乃至菩提際，成就如世尊前所立誓願者，令我兩手中自然輪寶，千輻輞轂明焰具足。』
translation: If I were to achieve the limit of enlightenment and fulfill the vow made before the Bhagavān, that would cause the natural wheel treasure in my two hands to be replete with the bright flames of a thousand-spoked hubs and rims.'

source_sentence: 「阿彌具王子適發言已，如其所願輪即在手。
translation: "After he spoke appropriately, Prince Amitâbha then placed the wheel in his hands just as he had vowed.

source_sentence: 復白佛言：『世尊！
translation: He then said to the Buddha, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若我乃至菩提際如是意滿者，令此輪寶往至五濁空佛土中出是大聲，如難陀䟦難陀龍王之聲。
translation: If I thus fulfill my intention up to the point of enlightenment, I'll cause this wheel-treasure to go forth into the five turbid, empty Buddha-lands and produce this great sound, like the voice of Nandopananda the dragon king.

source_sentence: 一切佛土聲唱是言：「菩薩受記入不妄念智。」
translation: The voices of all the buddha lands sing, "The bodhisattvas are memorized and enter the wisdom of not being falsely mindful."

source_sentence: 唱「修空不動意界法藏」。
translation: It's called, 'Cultivating the dharma-store of the empty, immovable mind.'

source_sentence: 一切眾生生其中者，此法藏聲入彼耳根；適入耳已，令彼眾生欲愛即滅，瞋恚、愚癡、吾我、慳嫉皆滅；令得思念佛境界智，發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心。』
translation: The sound of this dharma-store enters the ear faculty of all sentient beings who are born there; after it enters their ears, it causes sentient beings' desires and cravings to cease, and their anger, foolishness, selfishness, and stinginess to cease; it causes them to attain the knowledge of contemplating the Buddha's objects and to give rise to the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 阿彌具王子遣彼二輪，其輪甚速，譬如諸佛如來神通，如是往至十方無量阿僧祇五濁空佛土中。
translation: Prince Amitâbha dispatches those two wheels with great speed, like the supernormal powers of the buddha-tathāgatas, and thus travels to one of the five turbid, empty buddha-lands in the ten directions without measure.

source_sentence: 至已為眾生唱：『菩薩受記入不妄念智，修空不動意界法藏。』
translation: After arriving, he sings for the sentient beings, 'The bodhisattva is memorized, enters the wisdom of not being falsely mindful, and cultivates the Dharma store of the empty, immovable mind realm.'

source_sentence: 其中一切眾生，此法藏音入耳根已，一切欲愛乃至心意嫉妬滅；皆悉思念如佛境界智，發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心；須臾之頃，彼輪還來王子前住。
translation: After the sound of this Dharma treasure enters their ears, all sentient beings there cease all desire and even jealousy, and they all contemplate the wisdom of the Buddha's objective realm and arouse the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment; in a moment's time, the wheel will return to abide before the prince.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時寶藏如來歎阿彌具王子言：『善哉，善哉！
translation: It was then that the Ratnagarbha Tathāgata praised Prince Amitâbha, saying, 'Good, good!

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 如汝行菩薩行所願甚善，遣此自然輪寶至彼五濁空佛土中，令多阿僧祇億那由他百千眾生，住無濁心、無惱心，勸以菩提。
translation: As you've practiced the bodhisattva's practice, you've vowed very well to send this natural wheel treasure to one of the five turbid, empty Buddha-lands, causing many incalculable millions of those hundreds of thousands of sentient beings to abide in a noncontaminated mind and a nontroubled mind, and encouraging them to achieve enlightenment.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 是故字汝為無惱。
translation: "Therefore, I'll call you untroubled.

source_sentence: 汝無惱！
translation: Thou art untroubled!

source_sentence: 當為世導，汝可取莊嚴佛土，隨汝所欲。』
translation: You will be a guide in the world; you may adorn the Buddha-lands as you wish.'

source_sentence: 「阿彌具白佛言：『世尊！
translation: "Amitâbha said to the Buddha, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我求如是莊嚴佛土，所謂一切黃金為地平正如掌，饒諸天寶周遍其中。
translation: "I seek to adorn the Buddha's land in this way, which is called making the ground flat as the palm of your hand with all gold and pervading it with the treasures of gods.

source_sentence: 令無瓦礫土石諸山，地柔軟觸猶劫波育，足下則下，舉足還復。
translation: It will be devoid of rubble, dirt, and rocks, and mountains, and the ground will be as soft and gentle to the touch as an eon's wave, so that when you step down, it falls, and when you lift your foot, it comes back up.

source_sentence: 其中令無地獄、畜生、餓鬼之名。
translation: Therein, it's made without the names of hell, animals, or hungry ghosts.

source_sentence: 我佛土無諸臭穢，勝天妙香充滿其國，令天曼陀羅華周遍佛土。
translation: My Buddha land is free of odor, and it's filled with the wonderful fragrance of gods, which causes the heavenly maṇḍala flowers to spread all over the Buddha land.

source_sentence: 令其中眾生無有老病，無相畏者，無相惱亂。
translation: It will cause sentient beings therein to have no old age or illness, no form of fear, and no form of distress.

source_sentence: 令其中眾生無有橫死，死無悔恨，無不入三昧而命終者。
translation: It causes sentient beings therein to have no unintentional death, no remorse at death, and nothing that doesn't enter samādhi and reach the end of their lives.

source_sentence: 令其中眾生思惟念佛而取命終，終已不墮惡趣，不生五濁空佛土中，乃至菩提般涅槃，未常不見佛、不聞法、不供養僧。
translation: Let sentient beings among them contemplate mindfulness of the Buddha and reach the end of their lives, so that they won't fall into a bad destiny after ending, won't be born in one of the five turbid, empty Buddha-lands, or reach parinirvāṇa of enlightenment, and haven't always failed to see the Buddha, hear the Dharma, or make offerings to the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 令其中眾生少於愛欲、瞋恚、愚癡；令其中一切眾生修十善業；令其佛土眾生無受戒無犯悔名；令其中眾生魔不得便；令其中眾生無諸醜陋；使其中眾生無有貴賤分別；使其中眾生無我所無所作；令其中聲聞、菩薩乃至夢中無失不淨；令其中一切眾生愛法求法；令其佛土無有一人異學倒見；令其中眾生身無疲懈心無勞惓；使其中一切眾生皆得五通；使其中眾生無飢渴患，隨所欲食充滿寶器而在其前如欲界天；令其中眾生無有屎尿、涕唾、目淚、身汗。
translation: 令其中眾生少於愛欲、瞋恚、愚癡；令其中一切眾生修十善業；令其佛土眾生無受戒無犯悔名；令其中眾生魔不得便；令其中眾生無諸醜陋；使其中眾生無有貴賤分別；使其中眾生無我所無所作；令其中聲聞、菩薩乃至夢中無失不淨；令其中一切眾生愛法求法；令其佛土無有一人異學倒見；令其中眾生身無疲懈心無勞惓；使其中一切眾生皆得五通；使其中眾生無飢渴患，隨所欲食充滿寶器而在其前如欲界天；令其中眾生無有屎尿、涕唾、目淚、身汗。

source_sentence: 令其中無有寒熱；令其中香風軟觸以動人天，隨意所欲有求涼風，有求暖風，有求優鉢羅香風，有求木櫁香風，有求海此岸香，有求多伽羅香，有求沈水香，有求一切香風，隨心所念悉皆令得；令無如是五濁世界；令其國中有七寶臺，於彼臺中有七寶座，重敷茵蓐安置丹枕，觸甚柔軟如劫波育，人所住處令其寶臺周匝有池，八功德水充滿其中，彼諸眾生以此為用；使其中諸樹行列須曼那莊嚴，以種種華、種種果、種種香、種種衣、種種蓋、種種瓔珞、種種嚴具以莊嚴樹；其中眾生隨所樂衣，於如意樹上取而著之，如是華乃至嚴具隨取服之。
translation: 令其中無有寒熱；令其中香風軟觸以動人天，隨意所欲有求涼風，有求暖風，有求優鉢羅香風，有求木櫁香風，有求海此岸香，有求多伽羅香，有求沈水香，有求一切香風，隨心所念悉皆令得；令無如是五濁世界；令其國中有七寶臺，於彼臺中有七寶座，重敷茵蓐安置丹枕，觸甚柔軟如劫波育，人所住處令其寶臺周匝有池，八功德水充滿其中，彼諸眾生以此為用；使其中諸樹行列須曼那莊嚴，以種種華、種種果、種種香、種種衣、種種蓋、種種瓔珞、種種嚴具以莊嚴樹；其中眾生隨所樂衣，於如意樹上取而著之，如是華乃至嚴具隨取服之。

source_sentence: 我菩提樹令七寶成，高千由旬，其莖徑一由旬，枝葉分布一千由旬，微風來吹枝葉相[敲-高+亭]，令出柔軟過天妙音，謂波羅蜜、神通、根、力、覺、道之聲，其有聞者心得離欲。
translation: My bodhi tree is made of seven jewels, is a thousand leagues high, has a stem a league in diameter, and has branches and leaves a thousand leagues wide, and a gentle breeze blows its branches and leaves [knocking - high + pavilion] together, causing them to emit a wonderful sound that's so gentle it's beyond heaven, the sound of the perfection, supernormal powers, faculties, strengths, awakening, and the path, and anyone who hears it will attain freedom from desire.

source_sentence: 令其佛土女人具諸功德，譬如兜率天女，又其中女人無諸臭穢，不兩舌、慳嫉姤。
translation: It causes the women of that Buddha land to be endowed with virtues like the goddess Tuṣita, and the women therein are free of odor and don't engage in double talk or stinginess.

source_sentence: 使其男子不與女人觸身行欲，彼生欲心往觀女人，須臾之頃欲心即滅，生大慚愧而去，令得淨無塵三昧，以是三昧常離魔所，終不更生欲心。
translation: When a man refrains from touching a woman's body and engaging in sexual desire, the desire mind that arises in him goes to look at the woman, and in a moment's time that desire mind ceases, he produces a great sense of shame and leaves, so that he attains the pure and dustless concentration, which is a concentration that always leaves the demonic stronghold and never gives rise to a desire mind.

source_sentence: 彼女人以欲心視男子已，令即有胎，適視已欲心俱滅。
translation: After she looks at a man with a desire mind, that woman causes him to immediately enter a womb, and after she looks at him properly, her desire mind goes away.

source_sentence: 如是男女處胎身心受樂，譬如三十三天歡喜愛樂。
translation: Thus, a man and a woman who are in the womb experience physical and mental pleasure like the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven rejoicing and enjoying themselves.

source_sentence: 使其佛土男女處胎七日七夜如是受樂，女人懷妊亦受是樂，譬如比丘入第二禪。
translation: It causes men and women in the Buddha land to remain in the womb for seven days and nights and thus experience pleasure, and a woman who's pregnant also experiences such pleasure, like a monk entering the second dhyāna.

source_sentence: 彼處胎者不為不淨胎垢所污，於七日旦極香甚樂而得出生。
translation: That person in the womb isn't stained by impure womb defilement and is born with a great fragrance and pleasure at the end of seven days.

source_sentence: 令彼女人不受苦痛俱入池浴，令彼女人心即離欲得淨無塵三昧，以是三昧令離魔事常入三昧；先身所作業行因緣，應多億劫受女人身，令以是三昧得盡除却一切女身，乃至菩提般涅槃更不復受。
translation: He causes that woman to go into the pool without suffering or pain, causes that woman's mind to immediately part with desire and attain a pure, dustless concentration, and causes her to part with demonic activities and always enter concentration because of that concentration; he causes the actions and deeds of his previous body to cause him to accept a woman's body for many hundreds of millions of eons, so that he can completely rid himself of all women's bodies through this concentration, up to parinirvāṇa as a result of enlightenment, and then he'll no longer accept it.

source_sentence: 又有眾生，所作業行應過數劫常受胎苦，我逮菩提時，聞我名號心生喜樂者，於彼命終即來我國，受胎眾生，其中一切所作業行盡彼除滅，乃至菩提際更不受胎生。
translation: Also, if there are sentient beings whose actions and deeds will cause them to experience constant womb suffering for many eons, and they hear my name and become happy when I attain enlightenment, they'll come to my country at the end of their lives and be born in the womb, where all their actions and deeds will be completely removed, up to the point of enlightenment where they won't be born in the womb again.

source_sentence: 有眾生善根熟者，令彼華中化生，有少福德未種善根，令彼胎生盡諸業行。
translation: If there are sentient beings with ripened good roots, I'll cause them to be reborn in a flower, and if they have a little merit and haven't yet planted good roots, I'll cause them to be born in the womb and end their deeds.

source_sentence: 我國土中，若為女人若復入胎，令彼眾生一向受樂充滿；令微風吹須曼那多羅披帝樹，出如是喜樂之聲，苦空無常無我之聲，以是音聲，令其中人得然明三昧，以是三昧，令彼眾生覺明深空，令其佛土不出樂欲之聲。
translation: In my land, if a woman were to enter the womb again, I would cause that sentient being to be filled with joy all the time and cause a gentle breeze to blow against the Sumatra pṛthivī tree, producing such sounds as joy and happiness and the sound of suffering, emptiness, impermanence, and selflessness, which cause people in that land to attain the concentration of cognition and cause sentient beings to awaken to the profundity of emptiness and cause their Buddha-lands to be free of the sound of pleasure and desire.

source_sentence: 「『世尊！
translation: "'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我坐菩提樹下，願須臾之頃，逮阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: As I sit under the bodhi tree, I wish that in a moment's time I could achieve supreme perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 逮菩提已，令其佛土無日月光，亦無有夜，惟以華合。
translation: After achieving enlightenment, I want that Buddha land to have no light from the sun or moon, and there's no night, but a confluence of flowers.

source_sentence: 我當放如是光明，遍照三千大千佛土無不周至，以是光照令彼眾生得如是大明，見十方無量阿僧祇餘世界中現在住世諸佛世尊。
translation: I will emit such a radiance that will reach 3,000 great thousand Buddha-lands and cause sentient beings to attain such great insight that they'll see the living buddhas of measureless incalculably long worlds in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 我逮菩提時，當以如是聲說法，遍滿三千大千佛土，令其中眾生得念佛心，隨所住處經行坐臥及與迴轉，令彼一切常得見我，隨所疑法適觀我已疑惑盡除。
translation: When I achieve enlightenment, I will preach with such a voice throughout 3,000 great thousand Buddha-lands, causing sentient beings therein to attain the mindfulness of the Buddha, following where they live, walking, sitting, lying, and turning, so that all of them will always see me, and following whatever doubting teachings they've observed, their doubts and confusions will be completely removed.

source_sentence: 我逮菩提時，於十方無量阿僧祇佛土眾生，若求聲聞乘、若求大乘者，從我聞法，令得深三昧忍辱陀羅尼，即住不退轉阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: When I attain enlightenment, among the sentient beings of measureless incalculable buddha lands in the ten directions who seek the śrāvaka vehicle or seek the great vehicle, I'll make them hear the Dharma from me, cause them to attain the dhāraṇī of profound samādhi and patience, and then abide in irreversibility and unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 令我聲聞僧眾無量，無能數者，唯除如來。
translation: There are countless śrāvaka monks and nuns, none of whom can be counted but the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 我逮菩提時，在所遊行投足之處，令有千葉金色蓮華，我遣彼華至空佛土，彼華至已稱讚於我，彼諸眾生聞我名者即生喜樂。
translation: When I attained enlightenment, I caused a thousand golden-leaf lotus to appear at the place where I was parading and throwing my feet, and I sent that lotus to the empty Buddha land, and when it arrived, it praised me, and those sentient beings who heard my name became delighted.

source_sentence: 令彼眾生所有善根，盡皆迴向求生我國，於彼命終皆得來生。
translation: I cause all the good roots of those sentient beings to turn toward rebirth in my country, and at the end of their lives they'll all be reborn there.

source_sentence: 令我聲聞僧無沙門垢、無諂曲，為令一切眾皆悉如是。
translation: Let my śrāvakas and saṃgha be without ascetic defilement or deceit, so that all sentient beings may be like that.

source_sentence: 令我眷屬貴重於法，不貪財物不重榮利，樂於無常、苦、空、無我，勤修精進、敬佛樂法、重比丘僧。
translation: Let my followers value the Dharma, not crave possessions or valuing pride, delight in impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness, and diligently cultivate their energies, respect the Buddha, delight in the Dharma, and value the saṃgha of monks.

source_sentence: 令其中不退菩薩得入空意，隨所生處常說般若波羅蜜，乃至菩提際令不忘失。
translation: He causes his nonretrogressing bodhisattvas to enter the mind of emptiness, always explains the perfection of wisdom wherever he's born, and makes sure that he doesn't lose it up to the point of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 我逮菩提時，令住世十千大劫，般涅槃後正法住世千劫。』
translation: When I attain enlightenment, I'll allow it to last for 10,000 great eons, and after parinirvāṇa, the right teaching will last for a thousand eons.'

source_sentence: 「佛言：『善哉，善哉！
translation: "The Buddha said, 'Good, good!

source_sentence: 丈夫取淨佛土。
translation: "A husband acquires the pure buddha-lands.

source_sentence: 汝阿閦，於當來世過一恒河沙數阿僧祇，始入二恒河沙，於東方去此千佛土，有世界名樂喜，莊嚴成就如汝所願。
translation: Akṣobhya, in a future life that passes beyond one incalculably long incalculably long time and enters two incalculably long time, there will be a world called Pleasant Joy in the east that's a thousand buddha-lands away from here, adorned and accomplished as you desire.

source_sentence: 汝當於中成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，即名阿閦如來乃至佛、世尊。』
translation: In it, you will achieve supreme perfect enlightenment, which is called Akṣobhya-tathāgata or even Buddha, the World Honored One.'

source_sentence: 阿閦白佛言：『世尊！
translation: Akṣobhya said to the Buddha, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若我如是意滿者，於一切世界中，眾生成陰、界、入有形之類，在眾生數者，令彼一切皆得慈心，無怨心，無濁心。
translation: "If I thus fulfill my intention, then in all the worlds, sentient beings who are born into aggregates, realms, or formable types of entry will all attain a mind that's kind, without enmity, and without turbidity.

source_sentence: 令彼身意受樂，譬如住十地菩薩入蓮華三昧捨身得淨，使一切眾生身意受樂亦復如是。
translation: He causes them to experience physical and mental well-being, like the tenth-stage bodhisattva who enters the lotus-samādhi and attains purity by abandoning his body, and he causes all sentient beings to experience physical and mental well-being in the same way.

source_sentence: 如我五體禮世尊足時，令一切地皆作金色。』
translation: When I bowed my five bodies at the feet of the Bhagavān, I caused the whole ground to turn gold."

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 彼阿閦菩薩五體禮寶藏如來足，即時一切眾生受如是樂，如其所願，彼一切地皆作金色。
translation: That Akṣobhya bodhisattva's five-body salute to the feet of the Ratnagarbha Tathāgata immediately caused all sentient beings to experience such joy, and as he wished, all of his ground became golden.

source_sentence: 寶藏如來言：「『起住妙意無惱心，　　寶輪最妙在汝手；　　多億眾生得悲心，　　汝當淨意為世尊。』
translation: The Ratnagarbha Tathāgata said, 'Stand up with a marvelous mind and no anguish, the jeweled wheel is most wonderful in your hand, and many millions of sentient beings have attained the mind of compassion, so you will purify your mind and be the Bhagavān.'

source_sentence: 大乘悲分陀利經諸王子授記品第十二「善男子！
translation: The twelfth chapter of the Sutra on the Compassionate Partaking of Princes, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時海濟婆羅門，語第十王子尼摩尼，略說。
translation: It was then that the Haiji Brāhmaṇa spoke to Prince Nimi, the tenth prince, and outlined it.

source_sentence: 王子尼摩尼，其所立願亦如阿閦。
translation: 'Prince Nimi, he has made a vow like Akṣobhya's.'
'Yes!'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若我如是意滿，令一切眾生得念佛心；令其手中皆有海此岸栴檀之香；令彼一切以是妙香供養佛像。』
translation: If I thus fulfill my intention, I'll cause all sentient beings to attain the mindfulness of the Buddha, cause their hands to contain the fragrance of sandalwood on this side of the ocean, and cause all of them to offer this wonderful fragrance to Buddha images.'

source_sentence: 佛言：『善哉，善哉！
translation: The Buddha said, 'Good, good!

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 所願極妙。
translation: That wish is most wonderful.

source_sentence: 汝能使一切眾生手中，皆有海此岸栴檀妙香，發念佛心。
translation: Can you cause all sentient beings to have the wonderful fragrance of sandalwood on this side of the ocean in their hands, and to give rise to the mindfulness of the Buddha?

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 是故字汝為香手。
translation: "Therefore, I'll call you Fragrant Hands.

source_sentence: 汝香手！
translation: Thou perfumed hand!

source_sentence: 於當來世過一恒河沙數阿僧祇、二恒河沙阿僧祇之餘，阿閦如來般涅槃正法滅已，於後七日，汝香手！
translation: After one incalculably long incalculable and two incalculably long eons in the future, when the parinirvāṇa of Akṣobhya has ceased and the true dharma has ceased, in the next seven days, you will burn your hands!

source_sentence: 於彼世界成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，號金華如來、應供、正遍知乃至佛、世尊。』
translation: In that world, he became an unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, and was called the Golden Flower Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, and even a Buddha and Bhagavān.'

source_sentence: 香手白佛言：『世尊！
translation: Incense Bearer said to the Buddha, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若我如是意滿，我五體禮世尊足時，令此園中周遍雨瞻蔔華。』
translation: If I thus fulfill my intention, when I bowed my five bodies at the Bhagavān's feet, I would cause the rain to fall on the turnip-flower all around this garden.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時香手菩薩五體禮寶藏如來足時，尋遍園中雨瞻蔔華。
translation: It was then that the five-body incense bearer Bodhisattva paid homage to the feet of the Ratnagarbha Tathāgata and searched the entire garden for the rain of camphor flowers.

source_sentence: 寶藏如來言：「『起極妙德意善香，　　雨瞻蔔華周遍園；　　汝當顯示淨妙道，　　度多眾生無畏岸。』
translation: The Ratnagarbha Tathāgata said, 'Raise a good fragrance of the most marvelous virtues and intentions, and rain camphor flowers all over the garden; you will show them the pure and wonderful way and save many sentient beings on the shore of fearlessness.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時海濟婆羅門，語第十一王子名師子，略說。
translation: It was then that the Haiji Brāhmaṇa addressed the eleventh prince, who was called Shizi, and said in brief.

source_sentence: 即以寶幢上寶藏如來，『如香手菩薩所願無異。』
translation: He then took the jeweled banner up to the Ratnaketu Tathāgata and said, 'As the fragrant hand bodhisattva wishes, there's no difference.'

source_sentence: 寶藏如來言：『善哉，善哉！
translation: The Ratnagarbha Tathāgata said, 'Good, good!

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 是故字汝為寶勝。
translation: "Therefore, I'll call you Precious Victory.

source_sentence: 於當來世過一恒河沙數阿僧祇、二恒河沙數阿僧祇之餘，金華如來般涅槃已，正法滅後竟三劫，樂喜世界當名妙樂，汝當於中成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，號自在龍雷音如來乃至佛、世尊，國土莊嚴如阿閦佛土無異。』
translation: In a future age, after one incalculably long incalculably long eon or two incalculably long eons, once the golden-flower tathāgata attains parinirvāṇa and after three eons have passed since the cessation of the true teaching, the joyous world will be called Marvelous Bliss, and you will achieve unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment therein, being called the Tathāgata, the Self-exalting Dragon, the Thundering Tathāgata, or even a Buddha, World Honored One, whose land is adorned like the land of Akṣobhya.'

source_sentence: 寶勝白佛言：『世尊！
translation: Baosheng said to the Buddha, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若我如是意滿者，禮佛足時，令一切眾生得如是心，如菩薩住平等悲三昧，為饒益一切眾生求菩提者令不退轉。』
translation: If I thus fulfill my intention, when I bow at the Buddha's feet, I will cause all sentient beings to attain such a state of mind, just as a bodhisattva abides in the samādhi of equal compassion for the benefit of all sentient beings seeking bodhi, so that they won't turn away.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 寶勝菩薩五體禮寶藏如來足時，一切眾生得如是意，謂諸眾生得住悲心。
translation: When the Ratnasaṃbodhisattva's five bodies bow at the feet of the Ratnasaṃbhava Tathāgata, all sentient beings attain this intention, which is to say that sentient beings attain abiding compassion.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時寶藏如來告寶勝菩薩言：「『起勇善意大丈夫，　　能因眾生立堅誓；　　安立多眾無塵心，　　於天世人當作佛。』
translation: It was then that the Ratnagarbha Tathāgata addressed the Jewel-Surpassing Bodhisattva, saying, "A great man of courage and good intent arises, establishes a firm vow because of sentient beings, establishes the minds of many people without dust, and becomes a buddha among gods and humans."

source_sentence: 「略說。

translation: When the virtues of sentient beings diminish, the portents of a bad world appear, sentient beings abide in heavy desire, anger, folly, stinginess, and jealousy, and they rely on the mistaken views of bad friends, sentient beings are always attracted to minds with unwholesome roots, minds free of wholesome roots, minds without right views, and minds with wrong livelihoods; after the Tathāgata Kanakamuni's parinirvāṇa and the cessation of the true Dharma, sentient beings are blind and the world lacks a guide, and I will achieve supreme perfect enlightenment in 20,000 years of age.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 時寶藏如來告厚攝曰：『善哉，善哉！
translation: The Ratnaketu Tathāgata then addressed Houshang, saying, 'Good, good!

source_sentence: 婆羅門！
translation: Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 汝善丈夫具大明智，惡世人中瑞應出時，乃至二萬歲世人中盲無導師，於中立願。
translation: "You good man have great wisdom, and when an omen should arise among the bad people, even if you're blind and have no guide among the 20,000-year-old people, you'll establish your vow.

source_sentence: 是故，善丈夫！
translation: Therefore, good man!

source_sentence: 字汝為明智悲意。
translation: "You are called 'wise and compassionate!'

source_sentence: 汝明智悲意！
translation: Thou art wise and compassionate!

source_sentence: 於當來世過一恒河沙數阿僧祇、二恒河沙之餘，即於此娑訶世界，在賢劫二萬歲世人中，當得成佛號迦葉如來乃至佛、世尊。』
translation: In a future life that will pass beyond one incalculable and two incalculable eons, that is, in this sahā world, among people 20,000 years old in a good eon, they will become buddhas called Kāśyapa-tathāgatas or even buddhas and world-honored ones.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時明智悲意菩薩，五體禮寶藏如來足，於一面立，以華鬘香粖散寶藏如來，以偈讚曰：「『人尊多聞蓋，　　皆生喜樂意；　　以巧妙善語，　　善智處人天。
translation: At the time, the Wise and Compassionate Wishes Bodhisattva saluted the feet of the Ratnagarbha Tathāgata with five bodily prostrations, stood at one side, scattered the Ratnagarbha Tathāgata with flowers, garlands, and incense, and praised it with a verse, saying, 'The Venerable among Men, the hugely learned one, all become delighted; with skillful and good words, he has good knowledge to deal with humans and gods.

source_sentence: 授多眾生記，　　於十方作佛；　　神通智意等，　　佛法無稱量；　　尊現菩提行，　　故我稽首禮。』
translation: He grants assurance to many sentient beings that they'll become buddhas in the ten directions; his supernormal abilities, knowledge, and intent are immeasurable; his teaching is immeasurable; and he demonstrates his enlightening actions, so I bow my head in homage.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時海濟婆羅門，覺悟第四童子名無垢意。
translation: At the time, the fourth child of the awakening at the Haiji Brāhmaṇa was named Vimalamitra.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時無垢意童子前白寶藏如來言：『我欲如是於此土賢劫中求菩提，以不如是惡世，迦葉如來般涅槃後正法滅已，於萬歲世人中，眾生布施、持戒、修定心意轉乏於七財；敬惡知識以之為師，心不樂求於三福地；亦不樂修三善之業，反樂為三不善惡業；以諸結使闇亂心故，不欲樂求三乘之道。
translation: It was then that the Boy of Immaculate Conception said to the Ratnagarbha Tathāgata, "I want to pursue bodhi in this land during the good eon like this, but unlike in this bad world, after the Tathāgata Kāśyapa's parinirvāṇa and the cessation of the true teaching, for 10,000 years among human beings, the minds of sentient beings who are generous, observe precepts, and cultivate concentration are constantly lacking in seven assets; they revere bad teachers as their teachers, and their minds don't aspire to the three stages of merit; they don't enjoy cultivating the three good actions but instead enjoy the three unwholesome bad actions; and because of the bonds that confuse their minds, they don't want to pursue the path of the three vehicles.

source_sentence: 於當爾時尚無能辦菩提行者，況復千歲世人乃至百歲；爾時眾生無有善名況行善者。
translation: At that point, there's still no one capable of accomplishing the practice of enlightenment, so why wouldn't a thousand-year old person or even a hundred-year old person be able to do it?

source_sentence: 是五濁世壽命轉減，乃至十歲刀兵劫起，即於爾時我當從天上下，拔濟眾生使捨不善，為說善法，令彼眾生住十善業，以諸善業除眾生結亦除五濁；乃至世人壽八萬歲，我乃於中成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，為少貪欲、瞋恚、愚癡、無明、慳嫉眾生說法，令住三乘。
translation: When the life of these five turbidities decreases, and an eon of swords and armies arises at ten years, I will descend from heaven to rescue sentient beings, free them from unskillfulness, teach them good lessons, cause them to abide in ten good actions, remove the bonds of sentiency with those good actions, and remove the five turbidities; until they live 80,000 years, then I'll achieve supreme, perfect enlightenment, teach sentient beings with little desire, anger, foolishness, ignorance, and stinginess, and cause them to abide in the three-vehicle path.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若我如是意滿者，世尊應授我阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記。
translation: If I thus fulfill my intention, the Bhagavān will grant me the assurance of attaining supreme perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 設我不得如是授記，我當求聲聞地、若辟支佛速脫生死。』
translation: If I don't receive such a prediction, I will seek quick release from birth and death at the level of śrāvaka or if I were a pratyekabuddha.'

source_sentence: 「寶藏如來言：『婆羅門！
translation: "The Ratnagarbha Tathāgata said, 'Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 菩薩有四懈怠地，若有菩薩具此懈怠者，久樂生死為見所誤受生死苦，不速逮阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: "Bodhisattvas have four stages of laziness, and if a bodhisattva is marked by this laziness, he'll long enjoy birth-and-death, be misled by views, suffer birth-and-death, and won't quickly attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 何謂為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 或有菩薩，卑賤威儀，卑賤同學，卑賤分施，卑賤立願。
translation: Perhaps there's a bodhisattva who has lowly manners, lowly classmates, lowly gifts, and lowly vows.

source_sentence: 何謂菩薩卑賤威儀？
translation: What's meant by a bodhisattva's lowly demeanor?

source_sentence: 或有菩薩破身、口、意，或不攝威儀，與學聲聞、緣覺者俱，不一切施，不一切處施，求人天福樂施，不至意立願莊嚴佛土為度眾生。
translation: Perhaps a bodhisattva destroys body, speech, and mind, doesn't cultivate decorum, joins fellow śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas, doesn't give to everything and nowhere, seeks to give to the welfare of humans and gods, and doesn't wholeheartedly establish the vow to adorn the Buddha's land in order to save sentient beings.

source_sentence: 具四法，懈怠菩薩久受生死之苦，不速逮阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: Equipped with these four qualities, a lazy bodhisattva is subject to the pain of birth-and-death for a long time and doesn't quickly attain unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 有菩薩具四法，速成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: If a bodhisattva possesses four things, he'll quickly achieve unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 何謂為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 護持身、口、意，或常親近大乘學人，一切施，一切處施，為脫一切眾生苦故發悲心施，至意立願莊嚴佛土為度眾生故；是為四法，菩薩行是速成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: Protecting body, speech, and mind, always getting close to people who are training in the great vehicle, giving in all ways and places, generating compassionate gifts for the sake of liberating all sentient beings from suffering, and establishing the ultimate intention to adorn the Buddha's land in order to save sentient beings are the four things that bodhisattvas practice to quickly achieve supreme perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 復有四法，菩薩具足攝菩提道。
translation: There are another four things with which a bodhisattva fully gathers the path to enlightenment.

source_sentence: 何謂為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 勤行波羅蜜，施攝眾生，修辦諸禪，遊戲神通；是為四。
translation: These are the four diligent practices of perfection, generosity to sentient beings, cultivation of meditation, and play with supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 復有四無厭法，菩薩應具：施無厭，聞法無厭，攝眾生無厭，願無厭；是為四。
translation: "Again, there are four unwearying things that a bodhisattva should possess: unwearying generosity, unwearying hearing the Dharma, unwearying gathering in sentient beings, and unwearying vows; these are the four.

source_sentence: 復有四無盡藏，菩薩應滿：信無盡藏菩薩應滿，說法無盡藏菩薩應滿，迴向無盡藏菩薩應滿，濟窮厄眾生無盡藏菩薩應滿；是為四。
translation: There are also four inexhaustible stores that a bodhisattva should fulfill: faith in the inexhaustible store should be fulfilled, teaching in the inexhaustible store should be fulfilled, dedication to the inexhaustible store should be fulfilled, and relief for needy sentient beings in the inexhaustible store should be fulfilled; these are the four.

source_sentence: 復有四淨，菩薩應具：無我戒淨，無眾生三昧淨，無命慧淨，無人解脫知見淨；是為四法，菩薩應具。
translation: There are also four purifications that a bodhisattva should possess: purification of the precepts for no-self, purification of the samādhi for no sentient beings, purification of the wisdom of no-life, and purification of the knowledge and vision of no one's liberation; these are the four things that a bodhisattva should possess.

source_sentence: 菩薩以是速成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，轉虛空輪、不可思議輪、無稱量無我輪、無言說輪、假現輪、厭患輪、轉未曾輪。
translation: In this way, the bodhisattva quickly achieves unsurpassed, unfathomable enlightenment and turns the wheel of space, the unfathomable wheel, the wheel of immeasurable selflessness, the ineffable wheel, the wheel of verbal expressions, the wheel of false appearances, the wheel of disillusionment, and the wheel of turning the unprecedented.

source_sentence: 汝無垢意！
translation: You have an undefiled mind!

source_sentence: 於當來世，過一恒河沙數阿僧祇、於二恒河沙阿僧祇餘，入賢劫未久五濁以除，其壽轉增至八萬歲人中，汝當得逮阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，號彌勒如來乃至佛世尊。』
translation: In a future age, after one incalculably long incalculably long eon or two incalculably long eons, when the five defilements are removed before you enter the good eon, your life expectancy will increase to 80,000 years among men, and you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment and be called Maitreya Tathāgata or even the World Honored Buddha.'

source_sentence: 「時無垢意婆羅門，五體禮寶藏如來足已，於一面住，以華鬘粖香供養世尊，以偈讚曰：「『尊面如滿月，　　白毫相如雪，　　身淨如金山，　　誰不願牟尼？
translation: "After bowing his five-body salute to the feet of the Ratnaketu Tathāgata, the Brahmin of Immaculate Conception stood at one side, offered flowers, incense, and fragrances to the Bhagavān, and praised him in verse, saying, 'Your face is like the full moon, your white tuft of hair looks like snow, and your body is as pure as a gold mountain; who wouldn't wish for a muni?'

source_sentence: 雄猛如獸王，　　無量德照世，　　光明普周遍，　　今授我佛記。』
translation: As fierce as a beast king, with measureless virtue illuminating the world and a universal radiance, he now grants me the Buddha's prediction.'

source_sentence: 「大師海濟婆羅門，勸彼一千人，少一童子通四鞞陀得發菩提；所謂：迦羅迦，孫馱迦那迦，牟尼迦葉，彌勒子照等千人。
translation: "The great teacher Haiji Brāhmaṇa encouraged a thousand of them, a few children who had mastered the four vedas to achieve enlightenment, namely, a thousand people like Rājagṛha, Sundarī Kanakha, Muni Kāśyapa, and Maitreya Tzujo.

source_sentence: 少二童子通四鞞陀，彼一切立阿耨多羅三藐三菩提願，於此賢劫，寶藏如來彼一切阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記，於賢劫中其最小者。
translation: Of the few two boys who passed through the four vedas, all of them established the vow for unsurpassed, correct enlightenment, and during this good eon, the Ratnaketu Tathāgata recorded all unsurpassed, correct enlightenment, the youngest of them among the good eons.

source_sentence: 大師覺之：『咄！
translation: The great teacher perceived it, 'Duh!

source_sentence: 持大力！
translation: Devadatta!

source_sentence: 何以久觀？
translation: How can it be contemplated for a long time?

source_sentence: 汝摩訶薩捨餘意想，為眾生故可發大悲。』
translation: You mahāsattvas abandon other conceptions and have great compassion for the sake of sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 以偈告曰：「『眾生老病死，　　沒於愛流河；　　處在三界畏，　　受胎之微形。
translation: He told them in a verse, 'Old age, illness, and death befall sentient beings in the river of craving; they're afraid to live in the three realms and receive the tiny form of a human birth.

source_sentence: 飲結毒相害，　　曠野苦燒煑；　　癡盲失善道，　　為生死所逼。
translation: They are harmed by the poison of drinking binds, burned by suffering in the wilderness, deluded and blind, and forced by birth and death.

source_sentence: 三界苦熾然，　　皆住於邪見；　　一切在五道，　　譬如車輪轉。
translation: The three realms are blazing with suffering, and they all abide in wrong views; all are in the five destinies, like chariots turning their wheels.

source_sentence: 眾生尠法眼，　　念無救眾生；　　修慧除疑惑，　　今可求菩提。
translation: Sentient beings lack the Dharma eye, mindful of the futility of saving sentient beings, cultivate wisdom to remove doubt and confusion, and now they can pursue enlightenment.

source_sentence: 為世渴愛河，　　作眾生橋梁；　　解世結縛故，　　心迴向菩提。
translation: He creates a bridge over the river of worldly thirst and desire for sentient beings; because he frees them from worldly bonds, his mind turns toward bodhi.

source_sentence: 除癡開法眼，　　施以無上道；　　生死三界然，　　充之以法味。
translation: He rids them of delusion and opens the Dharma eye, bestowing the unsurpassed path; the three realms of birth and death are nonexistent, but he fills them with the taste of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 速可詣饒益，　　頂禮牟尼足；　　可立最堅願，　　為佛世導師。
translation: They can quickly attain benefit, bow at Muni's feet, and establish the strongest vow to be the worldly guide of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 慰喻諸群生，　　曠野濟眾庶；　　施妙解脫道，　　根力及覺分，　　為求雨法雨，　　以滅眾生苦。』
translation: He comforts the masses, helps the common people in the wilderness, bestows the path of marvelous liberation, gives his faculties and factors of awakening, and seeks to rain down the Dharma to end the suffering of sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 時持大力童子白言：『大師！
translation: The boy with the great power then said, 'Great Master!

source_sentence: 我不樂生死，樂求尊德；又復不求聲聞、辟支佛乘，欲求無上乘；我觀所化處，待時立願。
translation: I don't long for birth and death but long for honorable virtue, and I don't long for the vehicle of the śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas but long for the unsurpassed vehicle; I contemplate the place of transformation and wait to establish my vow.

source_sentence: 大師！
translation: Great Teacher!

source_sentence: 是故我住思惟至今，師待須臾聽我師子吼時。』
translation: Therefore, I've been thinking about it since I was here, and I'll wait a moment while the master listens to my lion's roar.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時海濟婆羅門，捨彼而還告其弟子五婆羅門常給侍者：『汝諸童子！
translation: It was then that the Brahmin Haiji abandoned them and returned to his disciples, the five Brahmins who were his constant attendants, saying, 'You boys!

source_sentence: 可發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心。』
translation: May we give rise to the mind of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment?'

source_sentence: 彼白師言：『我等無財寶物可供養佛及比丘僧，我等云何未種善根發菩提心？』
translation: They said to their teacher, 'We don't have any possessions or goods to support the Buddha and the monks, so how could we cultivate good roots and develop the mind of enlightenment beforehand?'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時國大師告其弟子，一名迦羅浮殊，即與七寶耳璩；二名他羅浮殊，亦與七寶耳璩；第三名闍羅浮殊，與七寶床；第四名佉伽浮殊，與七寶杖；第五名婆羅浮殊，與純金澡盥。
translation: The national teacher then told his disciples, 'One, Kālapuṣṭhita, was given a seven-jewel earring; two, Tālapuṣṭhita, was given a seven-jewel earring; three, Jālapuṣṭhita, was given a seven-jewel bed; four, Kākarapuṣṭhita, was given a seven-jewel staff; and five, Pālapuṣṭhita, was given a pure gold washlet.

source_sentence: 而告之曰：『汝等可以此物供養佛及比丘僧，發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心。』
translation: He told them, 'You may make offerings to the Buddha and the monks and nuns with these things and arouse the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 時五給侍進詣世尊，各以所齎施佛及僧已，而白佛言：『唯願世尊！
translation: The five attendants then went to the Bhagavān, each gave what he had to the Buddha and the saṃgha, and said to the Buddha, 'May it be, Bhagavān!'

source_sentence: 授我等阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記，於彼賢劫，我等於中當成無上正真之道。』
translation: Grant us the assurance of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, in which we'll achieve the unsurpassed true path in a good eon.'

source_sentence: 略說。
translation: Briefly, he said.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 時寶藏如來即與迦羅浮殊童子授菩提記，於賢劫中當名堅音如來；次後他羅浮殊當名樂相意如來；次後闍羅浮殊當名商導如來；次後佉伽浮殊當名愛清如來；次後娑羅浮殊童子當名清葉髻王如來。
translation: The Ratnaketu Tathāgata then gave the Kālapuṣpa boy the prediction of enlightenment, which would be called the Tathāgata Firm Voice, followed by the Tathāgata Rāhuṣpa, followed by the Tathāgata Jālapuṣpa, followed by the Tathāgata Shangdao, followed by the Tathāgata Kālapuṣpa, followed by the Tathāgata Aiqing, followed by the Tathāgata Sālapuṣpa boy, who would be called the Tathāgata Clear Leaf Topknot King.

source_sentence: 佛適授彼五童子記於賢劫已，時大師重告持大力言：『汝持大力！
translation: After the Buddha had appropriately given those five boys the prediction of a good eon, the great teacher again addressed Venerable Pūrṇa, saying, 'Venerable Pūrṇa!

source_sentence: 於世尊所今可立願，取莊嚴佛土隨意所欲，以法味謂一切眾生，堅固精進行菩薩行莫復久觀。』
translation: 'Now, at the Bhagavān's place, I can make a vow to adorn the Buddha's land as I wish, and I'll tell all sentient beings by the taste of the Dharma that I will resolutely and energetically carry out the bodhisattva practice and won't look away for a long time.'

source_sentence: 自執其臂將至佛所。
translation: He took his own arm and was about to go to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 彼時持大力童子，住世尊前而白佛言：『世尊！
translation: The boy with great power stayed in front of the Bhagavān and said to him, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於當來世後賢劫中，當有幾牟尼曰出現於世。』
translation: In the good eon to come, how many Muni's will be said to appear in the world?'

source_sentence: 寶藏如來言：『童子！
translation: The Ratnagarbha Tathāgata said, 'Boy!

source_sentence: 於半賢劫當有千四牟尼曰出現於世。』
translation: In half an eon of wisdom, a thousand or four munis will say they appeared in the world.'

source_sentence: 童子白佛言：『世尊！
translation: The boy said to the Buddha, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於彼賢劫乃至千三牟尼曰般涅槃已，其最後娑羅浮殊童子，當成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，名青葉髻王如來。
translation: After that good eon or those thousand or three Muniṃśas of parinirvāṇa, the last of them, the youth Śālavajji, will achieve supreme perfect enlightenment and be called the Tathāgata Qingyeqieqieqieqieqieqieqieqieqieqieqieq.

source_sentence: 我當於爾所時行菩提行難行苦行，布施、持戒、修定、多聞、精進、忍辱，隨福德智慧我當具滿，於彼賢劫一切成佛未久我先施供養。
translation: At the time, I will practice the difficult and painful practices of enlightenment, bestow generosity, observe precepts, cultivate concentration, be well-versed, make effort, and tolerate humiliation, and I will complete them according to my merit and wisdom, making offerings before I become a buddha in any of those good eons.

source_sentence: 彼般涅槃後，如舍利法供養舍利護持正法。
translation: After they attain parinirvāṇa, I'll make offerings to them according to the rules for making offerings to relics and safeguarding the right teaching.

source_sentence: 乏戒眾生，勸令持戒使住其中；少見困厄眾生，勸令正見使住其中；少意眾生勸住正意；無威儀者令住威儀；當為眾生示現種種若干善行。
translation: He'll encourage sentient beings lacking precepts to uphold them, encourage sentient beings with few views and difficulties to uphold them, encourage sentient beings with few intentions to uphold their right intentions, and encourage those without decorum to uphold their decorum; he'll show sentient beings various ways to conduct themselves well.

source_sentence: 彼諸佛世尊涅槃未久，我當復正法、眼正法、攝正法、興正法燈熾然於世。
translation: Not long after the Bhagavān's nirvāṇa, I will restore the right Dharma, open my eyes to the right Dharma, collect the right Dharma, and raise the lamp of the right Dharma to blaze through the world.

source_sentence: 刀兵劫時我當勸化眾生，使住不殺乃至正見，以十善業於邪逕路拔出眾生著善道中，除彼惡行闇冥，開示善行法，劫濁乃至命、見、結、眾生濁世，我當滅除。
translation: During the eons of swords and armies, I'll encourage sentient beings to abide in abstinence from killing and even right view, pluck sentient beings out of the path of wrongdoing with ten good actions, remove the darkness of their bad actions, and reveal the Dharma of good actions, and I'll extinguish the turbidity of eons and even the turbidity of life, views, bonds, and sentient beings in the world.

source_sentence: 飢饉劫時我當勸化眾生，行檀波羅蜜令住其中，我以六波羅蜜，除滅一切飢饉之劫濁亂鬪諍及與怨嫉，於眾生所除滅結垢。
translation: During an eon of famine, I'll encourage sentient beings to practice the perfection of giving and causing them to abide therein, and with the six perfections, I'll extinguish all the turbidity, strife, and enmity of the eon of famine and remove the defilement of the bonds in sentient beings.

source_sentence: 疾疫劫時，我當以六和敬、四攝法勸化眾生令住其中，除滅眾生疾疫闇冥乃至滅結。
translation: During eons of epidemic proportions, I'll encourage sentient beings to abide therein with the six precepts and four methods of collecting wisdom, which will remove epidemic and darkness and even the elimination of the fetters of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 一切娑呵佛土半賢劫中，如是救濟眾生困厄。
translation: During the eons of the half-blessed buddha lands, I'll thus rescue sentient beings from their hardships.

source_sentence: 千四世尊出現涅槃，彼一切正法滅已，於賢劫中，然後我當成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，如彼賢劫千四諸佛壽命限量。
translation: After a thousand or four world-honored ones appear in nirvāṇa and all their right teachings cease, then I will achieve supreme perfect enlightenment in a good eon, just like the thousand or four buddhas of that good eon whose lifespan is limited.

source_sentence: 我逮菩提已，壽命與等；如彼所有聲聞僧數，我聲聞眾亦當與等；如彼半劫千四如來所度眾生，獨我與等；彼諸佛世尊學聲聞者，設違失戒墜邪見林，不敬諸佛，多憎嫉心、惡心、害心伺求法僧，失心、過心誹謗賢聖，非毀正法作無間業者，願我逮菩提時，於生死中拔彼一切，安置無畏涅槃城中。
translation: After I attain enlightenment, my life expectancy will be the same; if there are śrāvaka monks, my śrāvaka followers will be the same; if there are 1,000 or 4 tathāgatas in half an eon who have liberated sentient beings, I alone will be the same; if there are śrāvakas who are trainees of the Buddha, who violate the precepts and fall into the forest of wrong views, who don't respect the buddhas, who are hateful and jealous, who harbor harmful thoughts, who seek the Dharma and Saṃgha, who denigrate the noble ones with wrong thoughts, and who don't disparage the right Dharma and create unremitting activity, may I, when I attain enlightenment, uproot them all from birth and death and place them in the fearless city of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 乃至我般涅槃，隨正法幾時滅賢劫俱盡。
translation: Even when I attain parinirvāṇa, according to how long it takes for the right teaching to cease, my noble eons will all end.

source_sentence: 我正法滅賢劫盡已，當令我齒及身舍利，變成無量阿僧祇化佛，具足三十二大人之相以莊嚴身，令一一相八十種好而自莊嚴；令諸化佛往至十方無量阿僧祇無佛之國，令一一化佛勸彼無量阿僧祇眾生使住三乘。
translation: After my right Dharma ceases and my noble eons have ended, I will cause my teeth and body relics to become measureless incalculable transformation buddhas, complete with the thirty-two major characteristics of a great person to adorn their bodies, and cause each of those characteristics to adorn itself with eighty kinds of beauty; cause the transformation buddhas to travel to measureless incalculable Buddhaless lands in ten directions, and cause each of those transformation buddhas to encourage measureless incalculable sentient beings to abide in the three vehicles.

source_sentence: 其有佛土為災劫所壞，令彼化佛往至其中，救濟眾生如前所說，然後令成如意摩尼。
translation: When a buddha land is destroyed by a calamity, have the transformation buddhas go there, rescue the sentient beings as explained, and then cause them to become wishful thinking maṇi.

source_sentence: 於諸佛土若有眾生乏無珍寶，到彼諸國如意雨寶示現伏藏。
translation: If there are sentient beings in those Buddha lands who lack treasures, then they go to those countries and wishfully rain down treasures to show and store them.

source_sentence: 又餘佛土眾生尠諸善業為病所困，亦到於彼令雨海此岸牛頭栴檀香，令彼香雨滅除眾生結病身患及與見困，令彼眾生勤三福地得生天上。
translation: If there are other Buddha-lands where sentient beings are beset by illness due to numerous good activities, he'll also go there and cause it to rain the fragrance of oxhead sandalwood on this side of the ocean, so that the fragrance will rain down and remove the illnesses, physical pain, and vision difficulties of sentient beings and cause them to diligently pursue the three stages of merit and be born up in the heavens.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我行菩薩行時，欲以如是濟度眾生。
translation: When I was practicing bodhisattvahood, I wanted to thus save sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我逮菩提時，如是作佛事。
translation: When I attained enlightenment, I thus performed the deeds of a buddha.

source_sentence: 我般涅槃後，亦令如是無量無邊諸佛土中救濟眾生。
translation: After I attain nirvāṇa, I'll also save sentient beings in these measureless and limitless buddha lands.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若我如是不得滿，不為眾生能作良藥而救濟者，令我禮佛已不見十方無量無邊世界中現在住世說法諸佛，今日世尊不授我阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記；又今世尊所授多億眾生阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記，令我亦不見彼諸佛世尊，不聞菩提聲。
translation: "If I don't attain fulfillment in this way and don't make good medicine for sentient beings and save them, then I won't see the living, teaching buddhas of the measureless, infinite worlds in the ten directions after worshipping the Buddha, and the Bhagavān won't grant me the assurance of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment today; nor will I see the buddhas or hear the sound of enlightenment after the Bhagavān grants the assurance of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment to hundreds of millions of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若如是意不滿者，令我流轉生死不聞佛聲、法聲、僧聲，不聞善業聲，令此諸聲不經我耳。
translation: If this is not to my liking, it will cause me to go through birth and death without hearing the sound of the Buddha, the Dharma, or the saṃgha, or hearing the sound of good actions, so that those sounds won't pass through my ears.

source_sentence: 令我常在阿鼻地獄。』
translation: It will cause me to remain in the avīci hell.'

source_sentence: 「寶藏如來告持大力童子言：『善哉，善哉！
translation: "The Ratnaketu Tathāgata addressed the Boy Vigra, saying, 'Good, good!

source_sentence: 善丈夫！
translation: A good man!

source_sentence: 汝當為眾生作善良藥脫諸苦難。
translation: You must create a good medicine for sentient beings that frees them from suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 善丈夫！
translation: Good man!

source_sentence: 是故字汝為無垢明藥王。
translation: You're therefore called the medicine king of stainless illumination.

source_sentence: 汝無垢明藥王！
translation: You Medicine King of Vimalakīrti!

source_sentence: 於當來世過一恒河沙數阿僧祇、二恒河沙數阿僧祇之餘，於賢劫中千四如來成佛未久汝先供養，乃至如汝立願，青葉髻王如來般涅槃已。
translation: In the future, after one incalculable and two incalculable eons, you will make offerings to a thousand or four tathāgatas in a good eon long before they become buddhas, even after you have made the vow that the blue-leafed topknot king tathāgata will attain parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 正法滅後，汝當成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，號曰樓至如來乃至佛世尊，壽命半劫；如彼賢劫千四諸佛聲聞僧數，汝聲聞眾獨與彼等，所度眾生亦復與等；般涅槃後正法滅時賢劫俱盡，如是汝齒及以舍利成諸化佛；如是乃至無佛國中雨栴檀香，除彼結病見困身患，安置眾生著三福地皆得生天。』
translation: After the cessation of the true teaching, you will achieve supreme, perfect enlightenment and be called the Rucika Tathāgata or even the World Honored Buddha, with a lifespan of half an eon; just as in those good eons when a thousand or four buddhas and śrāvakas were numerous, your śrāvakas alone were equal to theirs, and so were the sentient beings they saved; after parinirvāṇa when the true teaching ceases, the good eons will all end, and thus your teeth and relics will become transformation buddhas; thus it will rain the scent of sandalwood in no buddha land, remove their fetters and illnesses, see their bodies as physically distressed, and place sentient beings in the three blessed stages where they'll all be born in heaven.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時無垢明藥王菩薩白佛言：『世尊！
translation: It was then that the Vimalakīrti Medicine King Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若我如是意得滿者，唯願世尊，以百福莊嚴相足著我頂上。』
translation: If I thus fulfill my intention, may the Bhagavān put on my head the full measure of a hundred merits and adornments.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 時寶藏如來即以百福莊嚴相足以摩其頂。
translation: The Ratnaketu Tathāgata then rubbed his head with the image of the hundred blessings adorning his body.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 時無垢明藥王菩薩，心大歡喜意甚踊躍，五體投地禮寶藏如來足已，却住一面。
translation: The Vimalakīrti Medicine King Bodhisattva was greatly elated and rejoiced, threw his five bodies to the ground, bowed his head at the feet of the Ratnagarbha Tathāgata, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 時海濟婆羅門以天劫波育衣與之，讚言：『善哉，善哉！
translation: He was presented with the heavenly karpāsa robe by Haji Brahman, who praised him, saying, 'Good, good!'

source_sentence: 丈夫！
translation: Husband!

source_sentence: 所願甚善。
translation: That's a good wish.

source_sentence: 自今已後勿為我使，隨意所欲。』
translation: From now on, don't be my servant; do as you like.'

source_sentence: 大乘悲分陀利經卷第四
translation: Dasheng bei fentuoli jing, vol. 4
